meanings.definition: To gather or collect together again.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the coach reaggregated the team for a pep talk.
meanings.sent2: The students reaggregated their notes before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces reaggregated themselves magically.
meanings.sent4: The scattered clouds reaggregated into a storm.
meanings.sent5: The ants quickly reaggregated after being disturbed.

meanings.definition: To combine or mix together again.
meanings.sent1: The chef reaggregated the ingredients to make a new dish.
meanings.sent2: The colors reaggregated into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The spilled liquids reaggregated into a strange pattern.
meanings.sent4: The diverse group reaggregated into a unified team.
meanings.sent5: The scattered toys reaggregated into a neat pile.
